Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
Inventory
public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
Assessment: Assignment 1 Duedate: October 3rd 2021 Professor Name: James Mwangi Student Name: Kyle Thomas Description: A simple store inventory manager program
See Also:
Preserve, Vegetable, Fruit, Assign1, Inventory, FoodItem

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int DOES_NOT_EXIST
    Used as a return type constant to say something does not exist
    private FoodItem[] inventory
    Holds the food item objects
    private int MAX
    MAX Amount of Food item objects
    private int numItems
    Stores the number of items count

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Inventory()
    initializes an inventory array when making a new inventory

  • Method Details

    • alreadyExists

      public int alreadyExists​(FoodItem FoodItem)
      Accepts the food item object and iterates through the inventory array checking through the isEqual method if the food item code exists already or not.
      Parameters:
      FoodItem - accepts the food item object
      Returns:
      returns the i (index) of the object location or DOES_NOT_EXIST (-1) if the object does not exist in the array

    • addItem

      public boolean addItem​(java.util.Scanner input)
      A sub menu to the main menu which asks the user what type of food item they wish to create calls the appropriate addItem method after choice
      Parameters:
      input - user input
      Returns:
      returns true if the transaction works. False if there is no inventory available to sell.

    • updateQuantity

      public boolean updateQuantity​(java.util.Scanner input, boolean buyOrSell)
      Method which Updates starts the process for the quantity update. Prompts the user for the code which they are searching for, then uses said code in the alreadyexists method to check if the code already exists. If the code does not exist then the method stops there and returns to menu
      Parameters:
      input - user input
      buyOrSell - a conditional statement to guide the method through a selling process or a buying process
      Returns:
      true to continue and perform the update or false to deny the update.

    • mainMenu

      public static void mainMenu​(java.util.Scanner input)
      Main menu to the program. Acts like a director based on user choice
      Parameters:
      input - User input into the menu

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Prints out the entire array. This is the super(). Prints out the added information specific to each object on their lines.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
